Tyrael smiled slightly. The blue light emanating from him seems to
grow a little stronger.

Tyrael: Only a Major, Kaiser, but I appreciate your esteem. I am
positive that the Maximals here can't resist us, but I would like to
offer a proposal simply to show them the honor they deserve. They are
good fighters after all and they deserve our respect. If they refuse,
then we shall proceed. But with Hydras still around, it is likely our
both factions are going to have the same goal. If we destroy him now,
there will only be two major powers here: Maximals and Tripredacus. Is
that a risk we can withstand?

--- In nbwrpg@y..., Rudra656@a... wrote:
> ::Kaiser::
>        He shrugs and looks at Blackheart doubtfully.  "He has never
faced the 
> kind of force we have gathered here.  He is no match for two
Tripredacus 
> generals and a field commander (I forgot Tyrael's rank... oops).  We
have 
> nothing to fear."  He shrugs showing an utter lack of concern.
